sailpoint.object

Class CertificationEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.AbstractCertificationItem
          • sailpoint.object.CertificationEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, WorkItemOwnerChangeListener, sailpoint.tools.WatchableMap.Watcher<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class CertificationEntity
extends AbstractCertificationItem
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    The state of one entity(Identity, AccountGroup/ManagedAttribute, etc) within an Certification.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • CertificationEntity

        public CertificationEntity(CertificationEntity src)
        Entity cloner used by the new certification generator when we have to split previously built entities based on item ownership. Only worried about identity entities right now since that's all the new generator handles.

      • getSnapshotId

        public java.lang.String getSnapshotId()
        The unique id of the IdentitySnapshot containing the state of the identity at the time of this certification. Note that IdentityIQ does not own this and the snapshot might no longer exist if this object is being decompressed from an certification archive.

      • getDifferences

        public IdentityDifference getDifferences()
        Changes to attribute and entitlements of this identity since the last certification of this type. This might be saved in the archive, though in theory it could be reproduced as long as the IdentitySnapshots are still available.

      • add

        public void add(CertificationItem item)

      • mergeEntity

        public java.util.List<CertificationItem> mergeEntity(CertificationEntity entity,
                                                     boolean authoritative,
                                                     boolean markDiffs)
        Merge the items from the given entity into this entity. This method is careful about ordering of items because a specific ordering in parts of the UI is assumed.
        Parameters:
        entity - From which to get the items to merge.
        authoritative - Whether the given entity is authoritative. If true, any item in the given entity that is not found on this entity will be removed.
        markDiffs - If true, items that are added will be marked as having differences.

      • mergeEntity

        public java.util.List<CertificationItem> mergeEntity(CertificationEntity entity,
                                                     boolean authoritative,
                                                     boolean markDiffs,
                                                     boolean updateOnly,
                                                     boolean purgeMergedItems)
        Merge the items from the given entity into this entity. This method is careful about ordering of items because a specific ordering in parts of the UI is assumed.
        Parameters:
        entity - From which to get the items to merge.
        authoritative - Whether the given entity is authoritative. If true, any item in the given entity that is not found on this entity will be removed.
        markDiffs - If true, items that are added will be marked as having differences.
        updateOnly - If true, existing items will be updated but new items will not be added.
        purgeMergedItems - If true, items merged will be purged from the given entity.

        public CertificationItem getItem(java.lang.String itemId)

        public java.util.List<CertificationItem> getItemsOnSameAccount(CertificationItem item)
        Get any items that are on the same account in this entity as the given CertificationItem. This requires that the given item is an Exception.

      • isAccountRevokeChallengeGenerated

        public boolean isAccountRevokeChallengeGenerated(CertificationItem item)
        Return whether (if the given item is an account revoke) a challenge has already been generated for any other items on this entity that are revoking the same account.

      • isAccountRevokeChallengeActive

        public boolean isAccountRevokeChallengeActive(CertificationItem item)
        Return whether (if the given item is an account revoke) a challenge is still active for any other items on this entity that are revoking the same account.

      • isAccountRevokeChallengeActive

        public static boolean isAccountRevokeChallengeActive(CertificationItem item,
                                                     Resolver resolver)
                                              throws GeneralException
        Return whether (if the given item is an account revoke) a challenge is still active for any other items on the entity belonging to the specified revocation item that are revoking the same account. This version of the method uses the specified resolver to query the database for the answer rather than iterating over a potentially large item list
        Parameters:
        item - CertificationItem that is being queried
        resolver - Resolver used to make the query (usually a SailPointContext)
        Returns:
        true if there is an active challenge on any of this entity's items
        Throws:
        GeneralException

      • isEntityDelegated

        public boolean isEntityDelegated()
        Return whether this whole entity (for example - not the sub-items but the identity itself) is delegated.
        Returns:
        True if this whole entity is delegated, false otherwise.

      • getEntityDelegationStatus

        public AbstractCertificationItem.Status getEntityDelegationStatus()
        Return the status of delegation on this whole entity (for example - not on the sub-items). If there is no delegation status, null is returned.
        Returns:
        The status of delegation on this whole entity (for example - not on the sub-items), or null if there is no delegation status.

      • refreshSummaryStatus

        public void refreshSummaryStatus(java.lang.Boolean completeOverride)
        Derive a status summary for the entity. This does not refresh the status of the child items - it is assumed that these are already refreshed.

        Some ambiguity on what "reviewed" means for the entity. If the delegation says reviewRequired, then it seems redundant to require that the entity have an CertificationAction with the reviewed flag set, it can be imply that this is true if all of the child items have been reviewed.

        Specified by:
        refreshSummaryStatus in class AbstractCertificationItem
        Parameters:
        completeOverride - A possibly-null boolean value to override the completion status. This allows a rule to be run to prevent completion of items.
        See Also:
        CertificationService.refreshSummaryStatus(CertificationEntity, Boolean, Boolean)

      • applySummaryStatus

        public void applySummaryStatus(java.lang.Boolean completeOverride,
                               AbstractCertificationItem.Status itemsStatus,
                               boolean isComplete)

      • refreshContinuousState

        public void refreshContinuousState(Certification cert)
        Roll up the ContinuousState, the nextStateChange date, and the overdueDate from the child items.

      • refreshActionRequired

        public void refreshActionRequired()
        Refresh whether any action is required for this entity based on whether action is required for any sub-items. Note that this does not refresh the action required of the sub-items but assumes that they have already been refreshed.
        Specified by:
        refreshActionRequired in class AbstractCertificationItem

      • refreshHasDifferences

        public boolean refreshHasDifferences(IdentityDifference diff,
                                     Resolver resolver)
                              throws GeneralException
        Refresh the differences on this entity and all contained items. This returns true if their are any "compliance relevant differences".
        Specified by:
        refreshHasDifferences in class AbstractCertificationItem
        Parameters:
        diff - The IdentityDifference.
        resolver - The Resolver to use.
        Returns:
        True if any sub-items have differences.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

        Parameters:
        workItemId - The ID of the work item from which to roll-back changes.
        Returns:
        True if the roll-back caused any changes, false otherwise.

      • bulkCertify

        public java.util.List<CertificationItem> bulkCertify(Identity who,
                                                     java.lang.String workItem,
                                                     CertificationAction bulkAction,
                                                     CertificationItemSelector selector,
                                                     boolean force)
                                              throws GeneralException
        Bulk certify this certification identity with the status and parameters from the given certification action. If the entity is delegated and the request is not coming from a delegated work item (for example - workItem is null), the delegation is revoked.
        Specified by:
        bulkCertify in class AbstractCertificationItem
        Parameters:
        who - The Identity performing the bulk certification.
        workItem - The ID of the work item in which the bulk certify is taking place.
        bulkAction - The bulk action that contains the status and parameters to use to bulk certify this identity.
        selector - The selector used to determine which items are to be bulk certified. If null, all bulk certifiable items are bulk certified.
        force - Whether to force bulk certification on the children, even if they do not usually allow it. THIS SHOULD ONLY BE USED FOR TESTING!
        Returns:
        A possibly empty list of CertificationItems that were not bulk certified.
        Throws:
        GeneralException

        public Filter getEqualsFilter(Certification cert)
        Filter that will find a matching entity in the given certification. Note that this matches by property values rather than ID.
        Parameters:
        cert - The Certification in which to search for a matching entity.
        Returns:
        A Filter that will find a matching entity in the given certification.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        We override equals so that two objects will compare equal if they have the same database id or unique name, but are different Java objects. This is necessary for Hibernate because caches commonly have to be cleared or objects from one session need to be used to match things loaded in a different session.
        Overrides:
        equals in class SailPointObject
